intro: Lisaea papyracea, commonly known as paperleaf lisaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
